submission_summary.rationale: FedRAMP 20x Phase One submission based on RFC-0006. Control families AC, AT, AU, CA, CM, CP, IA, IR are drafted. System uses AWS GovCloud-native services, supports continuous validation, and has completed SOC 2 Type II in Q1 2025.

3pao_summary.assessment_summary: 3PAO reviewed the Key Security Indicator validations, supporting evidence, and continuous validation mechanisms. Submission is aligned with FedRAMP Low 20x Phase One pilot expectations.

validation_results.description: Have Denial of Service (DoS) protection implemented for all services.
Enforce application-layer traffic filtering and rate-based blocking using AWS WAF to mitigate web application attacks.
Configure firewalls/proxy servers to limit inbound and outbound traffic. (Outbound)
Configure firewalls/proxy servers to limit inbound and outbound traffic. (Inbound)

Design systems as logically segmented micro-services to minimize attack surface and lateral movement if compromised.
Terraform plan output validating the network segmentation and infrastructure-as-code enforcement of private subnets, utility zones, and security groups for cloud-native architecture.
Use cloud-native virtual networks and related capabilities to enforce logical traffic flow controls.
Execute continuous scanning of cloud native system components.
Use high availability design principles to maximize uptime.
Harden and review network and system configurations regularly.
Encrypt all network traffic.
Encrypt all federal and sensitive information at rest.
Manage configuration centrally.
Enforce system and component integrity through cryptographic means.
Use a key management capability to execute regular rotation of digital keys.
Use a consistent, risk-informed approach for applying security patches.
Enforce phishing-resistant multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all accounts.

Terraform plan output providing the infrastructure baseline for monitoring and logging targets, including EC2 instance placement, security groups, and subnet configurations. This context supports configuration scanning and monitoring validation.
Perform Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and configuration scanning using Terraform static analysis to detect misconfigurations before deployment.
Centrally track remediation efforts for vulnerabilities using ticketing systems.
Log and monitor system modifications through cloud-native tooling.
Execute changes through redeployment of version-controlled immutable infrastructure.
Implement automated testing and validation of changes prior to deployment.
Document configuration management practices and change control procedures.

Capture of Terraform plan output showing baseline infrastructure configuration, including EC2 instance IDs, subnet placement, VPC layout, and security group assignments. This evidence supports change tracking, configuration control, and CI/CD enforcement of infrastructure baselines.
Enforce configuration baselines through organizational policies and SOPs.
Assess the risk and potential impact of any system change before implementation.
Review and approve system changes via regular change board meetings.
Maintain an up-to-date asset inventory or codified infrastructure list.
Maintain security policies aligned to secure objectives and system functions.
Maintain a documented and published vulnerability disclosure program.
Embed secure-by-design principles within the system development lifecycle (SDLC).
Document and implement methods to automatically evaluate control implementation success.
Designate dedicated personnel and budget for security operations and governance.
Document and approve use of external services within the system boundary, limited to Elastic Cloud for non-sensitive metadata indexing.
Reflect external system integrations in boundary and architecture diagrams.
Document and validate data flow paths for third-party service usage (Elastic metadata search).
Declare outbound access restrictions to Elastic endpoints using Security Groups and NAT Gateway. Configuration is defined in Terraform.
Design includes GuardDuty and CloudTrail monitoring for outbound third-party traffic, scoped to Elastic Cloud endpoints. Validation will occur post-deployment.
Risk acceptance and system-level approval for Elastic usage is documented in SSP, justified by metadata-only scope and FedRAMP Moderate status of Elastic Cloud.
FedRAMP Moderate authorization of Elastic Cloud is confirmed. Elastic is used in metadata-only mode without storing or transmitting CUI or PII.
Generate and maintain a conditional SBOM for Elastic Cloud libraries expected to be used in production Low Mode, scoped to metadata-only use. SBOM is inactive unless system resources are deployed.
Vendor development practices and attestation are confirmed via Elastic public FedRAMP press release and authorization listing.
Ensure all employees complete annual cybersecurity awareness training.
Deliver core training content focused on phishing, data protection, and acceptable use.
Require specialized role-based training for privileged users.
Document and maintain a contingency plan with defined roles and responsibilities.
Develop a test plan outlining objectives and scenarios for incident response.
Conduct incident response and contingency testing through tabletop exercises.
Capture and retain evidence from completed contingency and incident response tests.
Maintain automated daily and monthly backup plans using AWS Backup to ensure recovery point objectives (RPO) are met.
Perform system backups on a repeat basis.
Provide operational personnel with quick-reference IR procedures and escalation contacts.
